alert.note: Alert for Charles City; James City; New Kent; Prince George (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 3:36PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Virginia, south central Virginia and southeast Virginia, including the following counties, in east central Virginia, Charles City and New Kent. In south central Virginia, Prince George. In southeast Virginia, James City. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 336 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Charles City, Holdcroft, Rustic, Ruthville, Providence Forge, Chickahominy Shore, Mount Airy, Lanexa, Diascund, Kings Corner, Roaches Corner, Sandybottom, New Hope, Brandon, Warren Mill and Governors Land. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; James City; New Kent; Prince George
